title: NVIDIA NIM Overview
description:
## NVIDIA NIM

This dashboard provides observability for your NIM deployments with the NVIDIA NIM Integration.

It shows information about how many tokens your model is generating per second as well as exposing low-level details such as GPU usage and Python memory management.

# Useful Links
- [NVIDIA NIM Integration ↗](https://docs.datadoghq.com/integrations/nvidia_nim)
- [NVIDIA NIM Metrics ↗](https://docs.nvidia.com/nim/large-language-models/latest/observability.html)
- [vLLM Documentation ↗](https://docs.nvidia.com/nim/large-language-models/latest/introduction.html)

definition.content:
## NVIDIA NIM

This dashboard provides observability for your NIM deployments with the NVIDIA NIM Integration.

It shows information about how many tokens your model is generating per second as well as exposing low-level details such as GPU usage and Python memory management.

This integration is currently in Preview. Its availability is subject to change in the future. 

Here you can see an overview of your LLM of your system activity and any NIM alerts. The service checks on the left speak to the health of your NVIDIA NIM environment, and the checks on the right report on the readiness of your dependencies.

definition.title: K/V Cache Utilization and Request Metrics

definition.content: The GPU is the workhorse of any LLM. It is also expensive to run. See here how many requests your GPU is running and how much you are taking advantage of its caching mechanisms.
These metrics measure response latency, input-output token balance, and token generation efficiency to ensure performance and scalability.
This section helps explore how NVIDIA NIM uses memory. The garbage collector collects objects in generations. You can see how each generation of objects gets processed.
